story.text: Jan 3 Mylan Laboratories Inc. MYL.N, a maker of generic drugs, said it received U.S. Food and Drug Administration approval to market Levothyroxine sodium tablets as a bioequivalent to Levothroid tablets, which treats deficiency of thyroid activity. Mylan said in a statement that Levothyroxine sodium tablets are approved to treat hypothyroidism and pituitary TSH suppression. (Reporting by Dilipp S. Nag in Bangalore)
story.title: mylan gets fda ok to market levothyroxine sodium tablets
